website_summaries.verdict: The rubber sole provides traction and durability that the classic Desert Boot lacks.
pros: An iconic style that will last longer than the classic Desert Boot
We love the casual yet dressy look of this boot
Suede or leather in a variety of colors
cons: May take some time to break in

customer_reviews.title: Dark Brown vs. Beeswax
customer_reviews.text: Sizes about a 1/2 large, so order down. Great looking boots, but not much sole support if you're going to be walking a lot. I had a difficult time deciphering the difference between beeswax and dark brown so I just purchased both. The picture has the side by side comparison with the dark brown color being on the left. They're both incredibly nice looking boots and nearly identical leather texture. The dark brown has a slight reddish tint with darker laces/sewing while the beeswax has lighter laces/sewing.
customer_reviews.author: R Trinidad

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the most uncomfortable shoes I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the most uncomfortable shoes I've ever worn, and as a 52-year old Army veteran that's saying something! I've been a size 10 since I was a teenager and these "size 10s" fit more like a 9. In addition, there is absolutely no support built in at all and the sole feels like concrete. I wore them for a few days thinking they would break in but no dice. Going to see if I can return them otherwise they are going straight to Goodwill. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Clarks' usual standards
customer_reviews.text: I've been happily wearing Clarks shoes for nearly 30 years. The fit and quality has always been very dependable. But the last couple of pairs of Clarks shoes I bought have had much lower quality materials with an inconsistent fit. These boots, for example - the leather was cheap looking (it almost looked like vinyl or a sprayed-on color finish), the toe of one boot was scuffed in several places when it arrived and the boot was at least one size smaller than the stated size. I guess this is how Clarks sells shoes for less than $100 a pair these days - they are obviously outsourcing the manufacturing and just sticking their name on a generic product. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: The Growler

customer_reviews.title: Returning these.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these as I have had some in the past. However these particular ones must be made differently. First, they showed up in a bag, not a box- and unsurprisingly, they came with odd scuffs all over. Visible marks and wear are unacceptable for brand new shoes IMO. Second, even after sizing a whole size down- these are still too big! Lastly, after lacing and walking a few steps in them the creasing was odd, and not in usual places. The leather is far lower quality than my old Clark's desert boots. I am returning these, even for the price- I don't even care to wear them at all.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: ATROCIOUS SOLE SQUEAK
customer_reviews.text: The design or material of the synthetic rubber sole on the Bushacre 2's vs. the Original Desert Boots causes a squeak with every step, every time I walk. I've been wearing these boots at work everyday for months in the hopes of wearing the squeak out but it seems permanent at this point. These are the worst boots I've ever owned. Stick with the Original Desert Boot. The more durable synthetic sole on these is nice but nothing is worth this squeak. I'd give these a negative rating if I could. Money wasted.Found numerous forums of Bushacre 2 owners having the same problems.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Clark shoes in the past and have for the most part enjoyed them. This boot, however is just uncomfortable. I bought these as a casual option even after having read some of the review about having to buy sole inserts. Unfortunately I headed out on a trip and didn't make the stop. Boy did my feet pay for that oversight. The sizing is accurate. The construction is quality. They have a variety of colors. But be sure you buy some comfort inserts if you buy these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Roast

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, low-quality shoes - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly unhappy with the quality and the customer service. The soles of the shoes have worn through in less than three weeks of walking. I tried to contact customer service but they took two weeks to respond. At that point, it was outside of Amazon's return window and now neither company is supporting a refund for the poor quality. Clarks customer service has not responded to other requests and I have little reason to believe they will be supportive. Clarks has gone from a company that used to make durable, long lasting shoes to one that now makes cheap knock-offs of their legacy models. Do not buy this shoe unless you're ok with replacing it every month or two.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Maier

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with these. Clarks has better options
customer_reviews.text: Positive: -Love the look. -The leather seems OK, not great. Negative: -The very first time I put them on, they started forming creases right away. -The coloring job on the leather is subpar. -They run about half size bigger. -Mine came with one of the eyelet grommets already broken. Brand new with a defect already ... annoying I am glad I ordered 2 pairs, so one actually fit. I am very disappointed of the quality on these. Usually I love Clarks shoes. I own several other pair of shoes from them and they are very comfy and good quality. This one is a dud
customer_reviews.author: DiM

customer_reviews.title: Argh! Walk the plank Matey.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of 10.5 EE (wide) Clarks Men's Bushacre 2 Chukka Boots. The Clark's Chukka boot is stylish and seems to be well constructed, however, there is no molded foot bed and the welt does not form to the bottom of your foot. The Clarks Men's Bushacre 2 Chukka Boots walking experience feels like you strapped on a pair of oak planks. I have since parked the Clarks Chukkas in the closet and purchased a pair of LL Beans Allagash Bison Handsewns Chukkas at twice the price. My feet are now in heaven and in a much cooler looking Chukka.
customer_reviews.author: Tad Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Chukka boots
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of pair of clarks Bushcre2 series chukka boots purchase from Amazon. First one is beeswax color which is a year old and holding up really good. So was tempted to buy the suede one and the green looks better in real life. As stated earlier these run big and Amazon offers the best price I have seen anywhere. These runs big, I wear dress 9 and athletic 9.5 but these fits 8.5 snug enough with room. Love these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but uncomfortable fit with at least one exception.
customer_reviews.text: I still like Clarks shoes a lot, primarily for the quality and look. But I have wide feet and Clarks used to cut their shoes a little wider than most, making them very comfortable overall. However, every Clarks shoe I have tried except one pair now has a long, narrow, tight, and uncomfortable European style toe that forces toes into an uncomfortable point. I tried at least six pairs from Amazon and Zappos and all were cut the same way. So, Clark's has fallen by the wayside and decided to follow the crowd instead of offer their distinctive, comfortable shoe. Their quality still seems to be very high, but the fit has gone down the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: This is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.text: it is very disappointing. 1. The shoes have different leather quality and color. This is ridiculous. It supposed to be same leather for the pair. One of them is very rough surface and dark color and the other is smooth surface and light color. 2. Sewing quality is also different. One of the pair seems to be made in Africa or some where. It is like I bought left shoe in US and right shoe in somewhere else in the 3rd countries. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most versatile shoe I own
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a chillier area, these boots are for you. They are incredibly versitile and can fit with tons of different outfits and settings; work, casual, bar, you name it! Initially these will feel stiff and uncomfortable. This is because they are made of some high quality leather, once you work them in a little bit they will be super comfortable. Some people will put insoles in because the sole doesn't really soften up and that is admittedly not so comfy. These boots also last for ever, I wore my last pair probably over 500 days before the bottom sole wore through. The top leather still looked fantastic though. I cannot recommend these boots highly enough! 6 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have high arches and wide feet and find myself having a hard time shopping for shoes. Clarks has always been reliable in thier sizing and quality. I ordered my exact size and these fit like a glove. They don't have as much support as others, and I would reccomend oththodics if you need support. But with that said, these are very comfotable. Ive had about a dozen comments on them during the time Ive been wearing them (2 weeks). These are also leather, so they will stretch and give over time. Of the dozen or so pairs of shoes I tried prior to these, I am extremely satsfied with these Clarks. A+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks good
customer_reviews.text: bought this as my daily working shoe. fits and looks great got alot of compliments. was scared at first because i live in the carribean so i knew i had to get the size right before shipping. so i just measured my foot as per the instruction and bought a size smaller as per the advice thanks guys
customer_reviews.author: kris latty

customer_reviews.title: A good boot with a few misses in the details
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I love the matte finish of the black “waxy” style. The exterior is well made and it looks like a high quality shoe. They’ve got style and they’re a great wardrobe upgrade. Cons: Only two shoe lace holes when 3 would be superior for fit, feel, and look Cheap shoe laces! I’m going to order some rounded leather ones. The insoles is not very comfy. There is little support. I’ve got a pair of vans chukka boots that are so much more comfy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Reccomend
customer_reviews.text: The shoes run very large, I typically wear a size 12 or 11.5W. These were much to wide and too big in 11.5W. I ordered 11W, still too wide. Additionally, there are only two eyelets neither up near the ankle thus this boot is prone to be loosely held to your foot no matter the situation. I recommend not ordering something like this on line. I work overseas and it is not easy to ship something back nor does it always arrive in a timely manner. I'm out the $ but a lesson learned. If the first doesn't fit---move on! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great option for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: As someone with VERY wide feet, shoes are often an area of frustration. Many brands are totally unwearable, due to their lack of width options. Not so with these! I measured the length of my foot and followed the provided size chart. The recommended size in wide was a perfect fit. Very comfortable. Win! These are not breathable, so you may want to swap out the insoles if you have sweaty feet. Also, the pair of shoes I received was distressed to the point they looked like someone dragged them down the sidewalk, which is not my style. However, I polished them with a dark brown shoe polish and now they look great. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: RiceVacuum

customer_reviews.title: Clarks are not what they are used to be
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift, very sharp looking shoes, very comfortable. However, speaking from experience, this particular model does not last long enough for the price it puts itself at (they retail this anywhere from $99-$128), and Amazon prices fluctuates. They are definitely not meant to be worn as everyday shoes, the soles do not stand for that kind of wear and tear like they used to, but that seems to be the trend with Clarks shoes, they have gone down in quality greatly. However, they are still nice looking shoes that will last you a while if you rotate them with your other shoes. Okay for the price, great for the looks. 6/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Peach

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality, sole wears out quickly
customer_reviews.text: This was my second pair of the Bushacre 2 Chukka boots and after 6 months of regular use the sole wore out and cracked in half. This happened with the 1st pair of shoes and well, i purchased a second set thinking the first pair had some sort of manufacturing defect but clearly this is not the case. Very poor quality boot, Clarks obviously does not stand behind their product as they have no warranty. You are better off paying a bit more for a higher quality boot.
customer_reviews.author: AlinaB_Life

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color, BUT....
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful color but that's about all the positive I can say. The shoe itself is quite uncomfortable and the insole might as well not even be there. The fit is stiff and the step is hard. The very top back of the shoe above the heel digs into my leg. $60 is a lot of money for a shoe of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyAngel

customer_reviews.title: Clown shoes
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely ridiculous size. I normally wear a 10.5w, bought these in a 10 because people said to size down. My feet were swimming in them. Seriously the 10 felt like an 11 or 11.5 or something. Only 4 eyelets to secure, makes a rather insecure fit. Then again they were already huge on me so maybe this isn't too bad. They look and feel very cheap and uncomfortable. I don't even think it had an insole. The leather creased like crazy after taking a few steps, looked weird. I don't think I'll bother trying to find whatever nonsense size they make that would actually equal a 10.5w.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schaible

customer_reviews.title: Men’s Dressy/Casual footwear option
customer_reviews.text: According to my son these have a much better sole then his last pair. But, the guy loves Clark’s Dessert Boots or Chukkas which ever you call them. My boys all have extremely wide feet and find these boots to be both stylish and comfortable. According to them they dress and and down very easily ... I’m so happy I got such a great deal in Black Friday because he was wearing a pair with holes right through the bottom 🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: K. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY SHOE AT REASONABLE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find a Chukka Boot by Clarks at such a reasonable price; many competitors price their boots at several times the price that Clarks charges. The boot is well made and fits the foot well. While I always buy a 4E in width, I could not find one in that size in Chukka boots, so I decided to try the 13W that Clarks offered, and it was sufficiently wide. While I'm an old guy (85) with bad feet and no shoe works really well, I'm able to wear these without much problem for several hours. So, thanks to Clarks for making a quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Gaston Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes...After Break-in
customer_reviews.text: These are my first Clarks and made the mistake of wearing them right out of the box to a work conference. After a 2 hours of walking in them I had blisters on back of my foot due to friction and my feet were killing me. Somehow I managed to continue wearing them the next few days (probably cause they were the only pair of shoes I bought). After break-in they much better, but would recommend adding insoles in them. The boots are resilient and still look great after a year of usage. Keep an eye out for sales they can drop as low $25 for a pair. Happy hunting!
customer_reviews.author: gTizzle

customer_reviews.title: Weird Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Beware of oversizing. The boots I bought (in my normal size 11) were too big. I kept them since I wear thick socks in winter anyway. I liked the style, somewhat retro looking, but was disappointed in the comfort. They aren't comfortable, but I thought I would wait till they are "broken in". And, it seems to me an additional lace eyelet design would have helped a loose fitting ankle. Kind of odd, actually.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Considering the low price for these shoes I expected finish irregularities and possibly a poor fit. I'm pleasantly surprised that neither is the case. I've had other Clark boots that used this sole and it wears like an ironclad, as good as their original crepe, and is comfortable all day long, nearly as good as crepe. Sure, the suede finish isn't the same as the $130 original Clark desert boot but it's still decent, and uniform in its appearance. So, it deserves 5 stars when you consider the $39 price and the qualities I have described.
customer_reviews.author: Beemer geek

customer_reviews.title: Great, ordered 1/2 size smaller than my normal vans size
customer_reviews.text: You can tell they cut corners with some of the quality of the product. Clarks quality control has significantly dropped. However for the price you simply cant beat it. Just throw on some leather conditioner or mink oil and you are ready to go. One reviewer stated that when you take them off do not use your other foot to pull them off. Loosen the laces and pull them off by hand. I believe this will do great to help them last longer. If all else fails, shoe goe repair should do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Find yourself an actually comfortable boot
customer_reviews.text: The boot is huge. Like, extremely. In tennis shoes, I normally wear a 10.5, in most other boots, I wear a 9.5-10, sometimes a 9. In these I had to size all the way down to an 8.5, but at that point, the sides were crushing my feet even though there was a good bit of room left at the end. It feels like walking on concrete, and they will never feel like they are secure on your feet. I don't understand the obsession with these, I really wish I did because I wanted to like them, but after trying out three pair, I just couldn't anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoes for a great price
customer_reviews.text: While I love the look of the shoes and even got compliments on them, as real leather shoes they seem to be rather tight and I expect to have a break-in period for them. I'm not sure if it's my foot or the shoe, but it's rather tight in my right foot at the tarsal and metatarsal region (around the middle of the foot) while perfectly fine on the left. Hard to tell if the shoe is just slightly off or if it's just me. I feel like once the leather breaks in they'll be a much better shoe and it's fairly common with higher end leather shoes I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Witt

customer_reviews.title: Great boots! Give them a try!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I have owned them about six weeks. I don't wear them everyday but every time I do they seem to get more comfortable over time. They do need wear to break them in and to give them the marked up and scuffed look which I like. I took the advice of other commenters and ordered a size down. These are a size 9 US and I wear a 10 US normally. They fit perfectly. I have had no issues with the soles or stitching as previous people have described. Would definitely order another pair in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sancal

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super stylish but as for comfort not so much. Update 2 months later after wearing them a grand total of 3 times: I can not for the life of me break these in . I have had clarks for years so I know Im not mistaken on the sizing. The top of the shoe has a pressure point that cuts of circulation to my feet. After wearing them for 10-20 mins I loose all feeling in my feet. This totally bums me out because I just figured ,hey .... Maybe they need to be broken in ... But at a high cost . I wish I didn't wait so long to return them or I would've.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like quality
customer_reviews.text: I've spent hundreds of dollars and a number of years getting "deals" on cheap boots, and decided to spend more on a higher quality pair, and man...this is it. Just an all around solid boot. The fit is about a 1/2 size larger than I expected and for the first few wears, the material is unforgiving and downright uncomfortable. That said, I'm 100% confident that after a month of regular use, they will have softened and broken in enough that these will become like a second skin. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Miller

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love
customer_reviews.text: I love these black Chukkas. This is my second pair in a couple months and couldn't be happier. Previous pair were the oiled brown leather. My regular size is an 8 medium and with these shoes I've found it best to order a half-size smaller. Note that there is a break-in period as the leather is thick and stiff (a good sign of a nicer leather) but nothing like the ordeal of a pair of Redwings. Very sturdy and comfy. Will buy another pair. Oh, and the price is crazy good. I'd priced these in a large department store and they were double the price. Win, win.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bowers

customer_reviews.title: All Day Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Husband wears these while standing on his feet all day teaching. I was surprised that the review asked for a rating on "water resistance" since the boots are suede. (So it doesn't matter if they are water resistant because you are not supposed to get suede wet.) Average support, nice sole. After a lifetime in the military my husband prefers boots whenever possible. These double as dress shoes, though I would label them casual dress shoes.
customer_reviews.author: 1912 House

customer_reviews.title: Low quality materials, look equally cheap, much too large
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10 usually so I ordered a half-size up, but these feel like they're at least an 11.5. I tried wearing them anyway but even laced as tight as possible they flop around too much. Seem like they'd be moderately comfortable, but I've only worn them for 5 steps so take that with a grain of salt. The materials themselves are low-quality as well, definitely doesn't feel like leather and the color doesn't look good on the material used. Too dressy for streetwear, too shitty to be worn for anything else. There are numerous small scuffmarks which will rub out mostly, and abrasions that won't, straight out of the box despite how thorough their packaging was.
customer_reviews.author: dinga lingdong

customer_reviews.title: Amazon prompts can mislead—read the fine print
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wear Clark’s for many years and while the picture looks like the original item what I received was a pair of fakes—not leather uppers and no gum rubber soles. My bad for not reading the fine print and your fault for listing them with the real item. Gave them to Good Will Industries and headed to a REI locally. My next move will be to bail on Prime thereby offsetting the added cost I had to pay locally. Thanks Jeff.
customer_reviews.author: Harv

customer_reviews.title: Great style, hard insole = not comfortable, Bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many boots from various brands. But Clarks has gained my support for its shoe quality, style, and being comfortable Clarks is known to be comfortable. I got the Beeswax Boot because it was promoted at $58.82 which was acceptable to me. It looks cool and elegant. However, the insole support does not feel as comfortable as I expected for Clarks. Definitely, not so comfortable if going to walk a lot. Minor stitching defect problem. Also, the shoe is actually bigger for me, even though the size is the same.
customer_reviews.author: Dear MR.J

customer_reviews.title: scuffs
customer_reviews.text: the shoe I received was brand new but looked used the pictures looked nice but the actual product is not like pictured I tried them on and walked acrose my bedroom took them off and noticed scuff marks across the top of the shoe just touching the shoe will leave a mark sent them back not what I paid for
customer_reviews.author: Stephen James Dziadkowsky

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes and an amazing deal when on sale. I've used these as my daily shoe for over a year, and they've seen plenty of miles. They are incredibly comfortable and look good despite the beating I've put on them. I added some 3/4 insoles to help support my high arches, and used them to trekk around Europe with a backpack; the rest of my body complained, but my feet felt great.
customer_reviews.author: Jevandezande

customer_reviews.title: It's Clarks
customer_reviews.text: Clarks are timeless. I got these in beeswax and they are great boots. They look great and I get a ton of compliments to feed my narcissistic demons. A bit of a break-in period for me with a lot of heel blister so you may just want to pad the back heel somehow to cushion while the leather breaks in. I lined a strip of fur to the heel which works perfectly. You also probably want to throw your favorite insole in for a little extra cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable, boots, not much grip from those soles though
customer_reviews.text: Clarks Desert Boots are a great, comfortable easy to wear boot. I have purchased multiple Desert boots in different finishes through the years, but recently realized that the grip is non existent in the rain.... I slipped sideways on a sidewalk grating in NYC and fell on my side fracturing my pelvis in two places! And no, I’m not out to sue anyone. Be careful on slick surfaces in the rain and don’t even think of wearing them in the snow or ice.
customer_reviews.author: Bloke

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Boot...A Few Scuffs Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Great looking Boot and the fit is as expected. The color was very nice. Not too dark, and not too pale either. My only gripe thus far is the boots came out of the box with scuffs on the toes. I understand that with leather there are natural variations in the grain, but these were scuffs obviously caused by an abrasion of some kind. Not really too noticeable, but noticeable enough that if anyone is expecting a brand new look right out of the box, well that may not be what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Tough boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are stiff. They're leather, so I guess I should've expected that, but the tops are cut your ankles stiff. Definitely wear taller socks with these on. They look really sharp, though. Unfortunately they're a bit too big. I wear a size 9 in everything (Sperry, Vans, New Balance, etc.) and my foot moves almost independently of the boot. Hopefully they're 8 1/2's are more snug. Maybe it's because I've never owned boots that weren't work boots, but the laces don't do much of anything. They have two holes on either side of the shoe for the laces and don't tighten the shoe up very well, which doesn't help with the size issue.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marvin

customer_reviews.title: My Everyday Shoe
customer_reviews.text: First thing these runs large. I wear Sports shoes Size 9.5 and Dress shoes 9 (including calrks dress). I settled onto 8.5 for these. And they fit fine with some toe space. So my suggestion would be to whenever you around clarks showroom stop and try one of those desert boots and get your size right. These shoes fits beautifully and I have worn it all day couple of time and they offer beautiful comfort and support. It takes couple of days to break in which is expected apart from that no complains.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: I love Clarks shoes and boots, and these are no exception.
customer_reviews.text: I love Clarks shoes and boots, and these are no exception. The only issue I have with them is the opening and the sole (see below) - could do with a little more padding as, after several hours of wear, it can cut a little. Would also advise using a leather conditioner on these to keep them in good condition. The down side - almost no grip on the sole of the shoe and, the sole seems 'thin'. After a few months of wear, I can already feel the 'grid' in the heel getting ready to come through. But overall, these complaints are minor and the boot is great looking and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ConBran

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control!
customer_reviews.text: I received my shoes pretty quick, but they are two different colors?! You can see in the picture the right shoe is noticeably lighter than the left. Not sure who packaged these, but anyone can tell they are wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable (for a chukka boot), durable, and look great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these. My first pair have been great for over two years of frequent use, and eventually wore a hole through the outer layers of the sole. They looked great the whole time, and I have had no other issues with durability. For the price, you cant beat it! As with most of my shoes, I use a Superfeet insert, and it really helps with the support.
customer_reviews.author: Corey K

customer_reviews.title: No arch support, tight for folks with high insteps
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these, since I like the classic look of the beeswax boots. I had to order them in a size up, since the ones in my usual size were snug. Even then, there were pressure points on the top of my foot (I have a high instep). I wore them inside the house for a few days, but they were still pretty uncomfortable and I had to return them. My plan had been to wear them with Superfeet insoles, but even with the bigger sizing, I would not have been able to put them on had I put the insoles in.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Shoe came apart after several times worn -- disgraceful
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a clarks guy. Still love them but for some reason this didn't hold up for years like my many other shoes making me wonder if I got a bad build or this are just fake granted I've always gone into the clarks store to buy the real deal. Shoe came apart after several times worn -- disgraceful
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: My favorites!
customer_reviews.text: Freaking love these. I’m big into my personal furnishings (as I call them) reflecting quality and design and these fit the bill. I was looking for a boot that would tell the story of our travels and these do it perfectly. What I mean by this is that given their wax finish, they will develop beautiful scratches, creases and live marks with every step. Don’t take this to mean that they look beat up, I honestly think that as you wear them more and more they develop a patina that ties them to you and is quite beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: M.J. Hullett

customer_reviews.title: These look great. They're also great value for what I paid
customer_reviews.text: These look great. They're also great value for what I paid. Quality seems good. But in a very un-Clarks like manner, there's essentially no padding in the shoe. Your foot basically rests on the hard exterior rubber sole, separated by a piece of cardboard or something similar. Most uncomfortable shoe I own. I tried adding Dr. Scholls pads to the shoes but they shoes became too tight, so that isn't going to work. Planning to keep these but only wear there to the office, or other places where I don't expect to be standing or walking much.
customer_reviews.author: freethinker

customer_reviews.title: Clarks Boots
customer_reviews.text: They look great but run a little small. I've own Clarks boots in the past and have known them to run rather large, which is why I bought my exact size (11). The first time I wore them I had to take them off after 4 hours because they hurt so bad. I had to by a pair of shoe forms to stretch them out a bit and now they fit better. I suggest buying a half size larger with these chukkas.
customer_reviews.author: BCA

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shoe. Going to take a little to break in, material a little stiff. Reviews correct, shoe does seem to run a little large. I normally take a 9 - 91/2 and a 9 is a good fit. I wear a wide, I ordered wide and again good fit. I'll order another pair in another color. One thing I really like is they have a nice grip on a wet floor so right now in winter, they work great
customer_reviews.author: thunderpaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes. I like 'em. They're holding up pretty well. They're my Casual Friday shoes. The laces, alas, are too far away; but if I were to lose a few pounds and a few years they'd be fine. Look great with a seersucker suit. You DO have a seersucker suit, don't you? These are not the old school, made in England Clarks, but they're still good. India's still part of the Raj, innit?
customer_reviews.author: James A. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, many sizes, fits Hobbits
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best pair of shoes I have owned. That being said I don't known high quality footwear. Following advice from r/mensfashionadvice on Reddit, I tracked down a pair. What I should say about my feet is they are wide and Hobbit-like. These shoes come in a variety sizes which means if you have massive feet too you can trounce around Middle Earth comfortably. I'd recommend these shoes to anyone looking for a high quality, decent looking boot at entry level prices.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Bushacres are much less comfortable than originals
customer_reviews.text: The bushacre sole doesn’t stretch at all. The crepe sole on the real deal stretches a lot. When I put on a brand new pair of original desert boots in size 11.5 it feels pretty snug but comfortable, and after a few days to a few weeks it feels perfect. With these bushacres, there’s no way the footbed is going to stretch to the shape/size of my foot. I’d have to go up a size. They feel much tighter on first try and uncomfortable compared to the originals. The wheat suede color is perfect but the suede is thin and layered with some lining material. I’ll pay extra for the real deal, I don’t like the bushacres.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classic look
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Clark's Chukka boot. I loved the other ones so much that I wanted to get another color. As many have mentioned, they do run a little large. I usually wear a 9.5-10 comfortably, but I sized down to a 9, and they fit great. I'd recommend getting some insoles because they are the most comfortable out of the box. They lack arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Dan V.

customer_reviews.title: Handsome shoes with a flat sole.
customer_reviews.text: These Clark's bushacre 2 chukka boots are comfortable and good looking, going good with jeans and a polo shirt up through dress pants and a button down. They have a smooth sole, so don't expect them to have much in the way of traction, as such, they're fashion shows more than boots, but they look and feel good doing it. The beeswax finish is handsome, takes marking easily but the marks give the shoe a rugged look that fits with an active guy appearance. I will absolutely keep purchasing these as they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Drummer

customer_reviews.title: Look good. Not very supportive
customer_reviews.text: Looks are deceiving. These boots are good looking and go with just about anything but you can tell they are not made for walking, working or anything that requires you to be on your feet for any length of time. Not comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Pete P.

customer_reviews.title: Tough to break in
customer_reviews.text: I will try and update this as I break these in, but so far this shoe has been a little rough on the old feet. I am trying to break them in and the first few days have been a bit painful BUT, I am aware that this is why they call it the "breaking in" process. They do look good and I am hoping the leather starts to conform a little bit more... I normally wear a size 10.5 but I listened to the prior reviews and ordered a half size smaller and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: adrian b

customer_reviews.title: Great look, very comfortable, dont last very long
customer_reviews.text: From day one when i got these shoes they looked great!. As i broke them in they got more and more comfortable. I noticed after a few months that the soles were starting to wear pretty fast. I do walk a good amount at work but i feel that these did not last as long as expected. After 7 months the soles are almost completly wore out. You can see the lines from the other side of the sole on the bottom of the shoe. Overall they are a nice shoes, Match with everything and look great with everything but if you walk a lot you might want to get a different pair
customer_reviews.author: Cody H.

customer_reviews.title: very tiny
customer_reviews.text: second pair. After the reviews said they ran large I bought a size 8 which pinched my feet for several months as I hoped they'd finally stretch. They did a bit, but I final gave up and bought this pair and 8.5 which pinched my feet even more than the 8's. I just received size 9 which always fits if the smaller one are too narrow. For the record most other shoes an 8 fits fine if they're wide. Hope the 9 fits because I had a pair when I was young and they were the most comfortable shoes I owned. This may be where I just need to go to a Clarks store..
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and versatile boot!
customer_reviews.text: I think the Olive Green version of this boot is underrated. It looks great with so much. A very practical everyday boot. Soft leather that requires no break-in. Wear it with jeans. Wear it with khakis or chinos. Very versatile. I already had another pair of these (brown), so I knew what size to order. I normally wear a size 9 in most everything, but I ordered a size 8. It fit perfectly. ****BE SURE TO ORDER 1 FULL SIZE SMALLER THAN YOU NORMALLY WEAR***
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wright

customer_reviews.title: Love the look, love the fit- quality is working out so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots a few months ago, and was a little apprehensive based on some negative reviews. I’ve worn these dozens of times, and put some good mileage on them, and I love them. I put a little mink oil on them, and the break in was a breeze. There are some clunky stitches, you can tell they aren’t top quality, but so far they are holding up great. I will update my review if they fall apart!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley G

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my husband in same size as all his other dress shoes of different brands and fit perfect. Can be work casually with jeans but also dressier with dress pants. They don't seem to have much support but maybe this is how men's shoes are??? He tried them on and immediately gave them a perfect 10 rating.
customer_reviews.author: lcglass

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but the laces, oy veh.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are fine, not the most confortable, but what can you really expect for the price. I would give them four stars, but the shoelaces are ridiculously long, so long that you have to tie giant loops in them and, if you are not perfect, they drag on the ground. I bought a pair of 20" laces for them which work much better. But the laces were $7. They ought to sell these shoes with appropriate length laces.
customer_reviews.author: Bob O'Texas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking, But the Most Uncomfortable Shoe I've Put on My Feet
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice looking shoe. Really. When you put it on, you'll find that it will probably need a hundred miles of walking to break them in. They are SO stiff! Lack of eyelets makes them feel they are barely on your foot too. Since I like the way they look, and they were so cheap, I'm going to not return them and suffer for a while to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for any man.
customer_reviews.text: Desert boots are classics and a must for any wardrobe. I went to a local store to try on a pair to find the right size, then came back and ordered it off Amazon. Did I feel bad not giving that store my business? Yes. Did I feel good about paying nearly $30 less than the in store price for my boots? YES. These boots break in really quick, and look fantastic when they are worn in.
customer_reviews.author: Jediwithoutacause

customer_reviews.title: Clarks quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved that they are made of leather inside and out. Leather is soft and appears to be of good quality. More cushioning would be appreciated, not uncomfortable but not as confortable as other Clarks boots I've had in the past. My only complaint is that I wish they had one more hole for the shoe laces. Other than that I would probably buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: ... exact pair of shoes from several years ago and loved them, wore them nearly everyday
customer_reviews.text: Had this same exact pair of shoes from several years ago and loved them, wore them nearly everyday. Repurchased these after I ran them into the ground and I can’t get comfortable in them. Worn them many times and my feet chafe in them so much that I have to change my shoes midway through work. The first pair I bought had no “wearing in” time and even if that was the case I’ve had these for months and after many attempts to wear them they still hurt my feet. Something must have changed in the way they make them bc they just aren’t as comfortable anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S

customer_reviews.title: Shoes done right.
customer_reviews.text: These chukka style shoes are everything I expected and more. The leather is thick brown wax hide, made from cattle leather. I am wearing them now, and breaking them in for a few hours a day for the first week. The soles and low heels are strong, stiff rubber and look as though they will wear well for a long time. Normally I expect to get 3-5 years out of a pair of well made shoes, and I believe these will measure up. I received the shoes in three days! Amazing shipping from Peltz Shoes. Priced right, built right, shipped right - all in all, a very good deal..
customer_reviews.author: Devil Dan

customer_reviews.title: Slightly narrow, Beeswax color different than pictured.
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit narrow in the toe area. I don't wear wides in any shoes, and haven't had that problem before (except with Asics running shoes), but with these I do. It's not enough to be a deal breaker, but something to be aware of. I got the Beeswax version, and they are significantly darker than the photos. I had originally gotten the Dark Brown, returned them because they were too dark, and got Beeswax, but they look exactly the same. These were very stiff when I first got them but have broken in nicely, and quickly. They seem very well made, will update if that changes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Zipperer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price , however I would spend more on something like Chippewa or Red Wing, Or Thorogood.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap boots that look good , however the quality of the material is pretty poor. After I bought these I decided to buy Red Wing Iron Ranger and Oh boy, how different they are, of course the price is 4 times more but I would rather spend $200 then $50 on something like these Chukkas. You will see that no matter what you do these boots gonna look cheap. Leather going to have wrinkles and you going to feel like they are cheap copy of real shoes .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 1/2 down and still too big. Might be because they are so wide. They have absolutely no arch support so I need to buy A new pair of Dr Scholls or similar. They arrived with one shoe perfect and the other badly scuffed on sides and front. Pretty stiff right now. I would think they will break In OK. I got them for only $35 so I am OK with them at that price point. Knowing what I do now I would not have bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Me_So_Honey

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality; Listen to the Bad Reviews
customer_reviews.text: The soles were already coming off before I had even worn the shoe. There were already visible gaps formed where the sole is stitched/attached. Terrible and disappointing quality. I returned them immediately. Do not buy. I wear size 10 in sneakers and ordered 9.5; they fit well. They look nice, but are not worth it. The shoe distresses really easily; this is good or bad depending on you.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Runs really large, top looks discolored after use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a legitimate 11.5 and a really float around in these. Also have noticed that the more I walk around in these, the more the front toe shell stands out. That makes them look kind of odd rather than maintaining a consistent smooth look over the top surface of the shoe. Haven't had them long enough to know how the gum bottom will hold out but will update this review if it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice looking but hard insole
customer_reviews.text: The leather is a bit stiff but looks very nice. It's a loose fit given the 2 eyelet approach - up to you if that is what you want. I ordered a half size small and seemed just fine. The problem for me was, the insole, apart from some modest padding at the heel, is very hard, so hard the I sent them back. It appears to be a fibrous material that won't be form fitting with time. If you want to get these shoes, you probably will want to get after market insoles for some cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Pboss

customer_reviews.title: I like this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe. It's a very dark brown (Chocolate color) and it took a long time to break in. The suggestion to put on 5 pairs of socks, stuff yourself into it, tighten the laces, and use a hairdryer while trying to flex your feet really worked well! Now they're very comfortable. In hindsight I wish I would have gone with beeswax though because that lighter brown is a bit more casual. These look great with blue/black jeans as well as every color of khakis I have. Very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cat

customer_reviews.title: hit the mark!
customer_reviews.text: Clark quality and craftsmanship continues in this chukka boot. Footwear seems to fit me better when I rely upon UK sizing, and these were true to size. I’ve had NO problems with the breaking-in period; the leather is thick enough to last but it’s not so stiff that it might cause a blister. I’ve spent more than a couple of full days in them getting 10,000+ steps (plus a rain storm), and they’re serving me well. Although there’s no lug sole, I’ve had no problems with footing-which is a plus as far as I’m concerned because I don’t have to worry about tracking in mud when I enter the house. They’re quickly becoming my favorite casual shoes.
customer_reviews.author: peregrino

customer_reviews.title: Size not standard
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes for my grandson for Christmas. I know Clark’s to be a good brand in women’s shoes, but have not had experience with men’s. My grandson wears a 15 in all shoes, so that is what I ordered. However, he literally could walk out of a 15. We sent them back, and ordered a 13. The 13 seems to fit just right, and look nice, but the size descrepancy is confusing. He hasn’t worn them yet, so time will tell us if they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Moffatt

customer_reviews.title: Narrow arch with no support. Well made, though.
customer_reviews.text: Has a fairly narrow arch, which I find very strange. Once I put some insoles in them, this was no longer a problem, but until then they were fairly uncomfortable. Also, really doesn't come with an insole, and the foot bed has no arch support at all. For this style of shoe, and for being made completely out of leather, this is a pretty good deal. Also, the build quality is actually very good.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kelderman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The right shoe looks great, but the left looks visibly worn. So much so that the color is off compared to the right shoe. The suede fabric looks a bit rough compared to the right as well. They weren’t very expensive, so I’m not that upset.. just disappointed and annoyed since they were a bday gift to my husband. I’m reluctant to purchase anything further from Clark’s. I will say that the advice to purchase a half size down is correct. I did so and they fit my husband great.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Clarks, swing and a miss.
customer_reviews.text: Clarks continues to disappoint me. These really do look good, but there is so much wrong here. They stitch the insoles in place. Really? The footbed is flat with no thought of support and because you cannot remove the insole, there is no room for an aftermarket support insole. The leather looks good, but it is very, very thin on the upper. It is glued to a liner and one shoe shows wrinkling already wear it wasn't glued together very well. One the plus side, they do fit true to size and the toebox is roomy. And really the look is good. But I would not buy again and would definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: myotis

customer_reviews.title: Looks are deceiving- don't let your eyes hurt your feet!
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of the style and leather. The photo shows how empty the promise of a well-made, stylish, comfortable, quality shoe was. There is literally no insole, unless a paper thin sheet of unknown material is considered as such, the similar piece with the Clarks trademark is basically the same. So, no insole, no foot bed and no arch support. This is essentially a rubber sole and heel with leather sewn directly to it in the shape of a shoe. I would never buy this, or any Clark shoes on line again. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Jones

customer_reviews.title: Definitely purchase these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on a wonderful shoe. I purchased as a gift because for many yeara my boyfriend has worn the same pair, although they lasted several years it was time for an upgrade. I purchased the same ones because i knew they were of great quality, and would last for several years just like the last pair. I would definitely recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: cristen austin

customer_reviews.title: Great style - Poor fit - Hard midsole
customer_reviews.text: The style is great. However it doesn't fit good. It is difficult to have a good lock down and you can have heel slippage. The biggest drawback is the outsole & midsole is very stiff and has absolutely no cushioning. What a shame. Another issue is the leather creasing in the front pinches my feet and toe causing discomfort. You can add an insert but make sure to order your true size and not size down half down a size as suggested by reviewers - there won't be enough room for an insert. I don't recommend this version - definitely go with the crepe sole for more comfort. I ended up giving the shoe away.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan S

customer_reviews.title: Terribly uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the worst pairs of shoe's I've ever owned. I've worn them 5 or 6 times in the two weeks that I've had them and they don't feel any better than the first day. They're terribly uncomfortable and stiff. The top of one shoe creases and digs into the top of my foot when I walk. Since they're so stiff it feel like your foot is being stepped on. I thought Clarks were supposed to be decent shoes, but this will definitely be the last pair I'll ever own!
customer_reviews.author: NRB

customer_reviews.title: Classic look for everyday wear
customer_reviews.text: So I've always wanted a pair of Clark's chukka boots and when I came across the on sale deal ($48.99) I decided it was time. Couple notes as there has been mixed reviews: 1. Yes, the beezwax color is darker in person, but I believe as you wear them more and they get that worn rugged look they'll lighten up. 2. They are not the softest in-sole for chukka boots(pretty hard but walking around hasn't really bothered me) 3. I think they have the best classic look to a chukka boot in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Familiar with the quality reputation of Clark’s shoes I was excited to find these at a great price and my favorite style
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my husband, he needed new brown shoes, I of course went to my “go to”, Amazon. Familiar with the quality reputation of Clark’s shoes I was excited to find these at a great price and my favorite style. Well that’s me more importantly my husband LOVES these shoes, his new all time favorite! I have been asked to get them for him in tan. He likes the look and the rich deep brown leather, also when I asked him his opinion for this review, being a man of few words, he replied (as I expected) “they are very comfortable.”
customer_reviews.author: Mary Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great looking boot but take caution.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the BushAcre boots. I have 2 pair however there is no support at all. I intended on wearing these daily for work and my soles and lower back are now in pain. I attempted to purchase insoles but that squeezed the fit a bit too tight as the top of my foot was now pinched under the laces. I now have insoles that are just the heel portion of the boots but the balls of my foot still ache. These are great looking shoes but just can’t be worn on a daily basis ..
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Worst sizing ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst pair of shoes I have ever brought. I downsized half a size just like most people have said to do. The shoe is still a entire size too large and I have passed the return period. I will never be buying Clark shoes again. The sizing is so far off, it is incredible that this was possible. This isnt even a cheap shoe, it's just expensive junk.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: because I find the latter much more comfortable. These are good enough comfort-wise
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn these for a couple of days but they have stretched out from an initial firm fit to quite comfy. The inner is man made and not leather which is a shame, because I find the latter much more comfortable. These are good enough comfort-wise, and I have pretty sensitive feet to that. Good sturdy construction it appears from the look and feel of them. Good thick sole. Not the prettiest of boots but by no means ugly. I wouldn't call them dress shoes at any pinch, but they are good sturdy work shoes (okay for the office if it's not too formal).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Longer to break in compared to my old pair of Clarks.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned three other pairs of Clarks desert boots and these are comparable to them. The fit is just about the same but the break in period for these was much longer than my older pair. It might be difference in the material they use now compared to the old beeswax color from 6 years ago. Overall, good pair of comfy shoe with timeless style.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Li

customer_reviews.title: Zero insole support - need a 3rd eyelet
customer_reviews.text: These are nice boots but there are certain defects - 1. they need a 3rd eyelet in order to lace them up tight enough. 2 eyelets aren't enough to secure them to your foot. 2. if your not going to sit down all day and plan on doing any walking at all you need some sort of insole because these have nothing - it's like walking on cardboard The problem is that an insole causes the fit to be tight so I had to resort to a heelcup. not sure why these are rated so highly as they aren't anything special and I wouldn't order again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Humes

customer_reviews.title: Great look.. tough to size
customer_reviews.text: I just received my second pair of Clark's after the first size was WAY too large. This second pair is a bit tight across the top (there is no W size when you get to size: 7.5). For that reason alone, it's probably best that you pick these up in a store and try them on. The good is that they look great. I got the Beeswax-colored edition and they do a great job dressing up a pair of jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Narucki

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a size 10 but I did have a pair of Clark boots that were a 9.5. Info said they ran large so I ordered a 9.5 and a 10 and found both to be too large. I do believe that having just two eyelets prevents the boots from lacing tightly and 3 or 4 eyelets would be much better to obtain proper fit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should own a pair...
customer_reviews.text: I hiked mountains in 110 degree desert heat in these boots on multiple occasions. My first pair fell apart after seven years of this abuse (Purchased from Penny’s[is there an E after the N, I’m too lazy to google it{do you capitalize google when using it as a verb?}] in El Paso, TX 2009). I bought two pairs recently because I missed them so much. One for formal wear, because the look is classic, and one for everyday wear. Favorite shoes I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handsome shoes. Handsome and painful.
customer_reviews.text: No picture because these do look like their product picture. They are nice looking shoes, appearance-wise, they nailed it. To get an idea for how these shoes FEEL on your precious feet, I’d recommend strapping foot sized lumbar on. If you intend to bear weight while wearing these shoes, invest in some after market space foam inserts, otherwise see which podiatrist is in your provider network. They hurt. They’re also made cheaply. I can already see signs of whatever glue(?!) is keeping the shoe to the concrete-like sole.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Willis

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, clean and basic chukka, a bit uncomfortable for my wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe but it a bit uncomfortable on my feet. My toes start to really hurt after walking around for more than half an hour. I've had them for several months now and was hoping it would be just a matter of breaking them in. Granted, I have wide feet so that could have something to do with it. These are okay for wearing around the office where I'm sitting most the day. I'd be in pain if I was standing on my feet all days in these. I even have some foam inserts and it's not helping much.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

product_meta.title: Clarks Men's Bushacre 2 Chukka Boot
product_meta.description:
Chucka boot.How to measure your foot:Place your foot on a flat surface with your heel against a straight edge. Place a ruler beside your foot touching the straight edge your heel is also touching, then take the length in millimetres from the tip of your longest toe to your heel. Please be aware that your longest toe may not always be your big toe. Fit: This style tends to run large. For an accurate fit we recommend purchasing a 0.5 size smaller than you typically purchase. For example, if you normally purchase a size 7.5, we recommend purchasing a size 7.Sole Material: Crepe

Clarks has been in business for over 100 years making very fine men's dress shoes in a variety of styles. Featuring a wide range of top-quality components, Clarks gives you the options you desire in the quality you demand.
feature_bullets: Platform measures approximately 0.75 inches inches inches
The finish or polish on these boots show marks which are not scratches
Chukka boot silhouette , Two eyelet lace-up front , Cushioned insole
Note:Color shade may vary due to lighting; Sole Material: Crepe
